intro: Senecio formosoides, commonly known as the African Daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its vibrant yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a striking visual element to the landscape. Senecio formosoides is also known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions, making it a hardy and low-maintenance plant.
